body_html:
Unfortunately Maven doesn't offer much help there. The native lib is typically assumed to be preinstalled.

I have seen instances where libraries tuck away their jni libs (for all supported platforms) into the jar, then extract them at runtime. Similar to:

nathanmarz/jzmq@e6c3c0b

https://github.com/os72/protoc-jar/blob/master/README.md
body_text:
Unfortunately Maven doesn't offer much help there.  The native lib is typically assumed to be preinstalled.
I have seen instances where libraries tuck away their jni libs (for all supported platforms) into the jar, then extract them at runtime.  Similar to:
nathanmarz/jzmq@e6c3c0b
https://github.com/os72/protoc-jar/blob/master/README.md
body:
Unfortunately Maven doesn't offer much help there.  The native lib is typically assumed to be preinstalled.  

I have seen instances where libraries tuck away their jni libs (for all supported platforms) into the jar, then extract them at runtime.  Similar to:

https://github.com/nathanmarz/jzmq/commit/e6c3c0b8966180a379b2a4aec64d7fd5fac5db38#

https://github.com/os72/protoc-jar/blob/master/README.md
